name: 曾祥森
objective:
OUTLINES
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The contents of Calculus(II)
includes: 1.Techniques of Integration, 2.Polar Coordinates, 3.Vectors and the Geometry of Space, 4.Vector-Valued Functions and Motion in Space, 5.Partial Derivatives, 6.Multiple Integrals, 7.Infinite Series.
schedule:
SYLLABUS
Week 1 ---Integration by substitutions, Integration by parts
Week 2 ---Trigonometric integrals, Trigonometric substitutions
Week 3 ---Integration by partial fractions, Miscellaneous methods
Week 4 ---Numerical integration, Improper integrals
Week 5 ---Polar coordinates, Graphing in polar coordinates  
          (First Test)
Week 6 ---Areas and lengths in polar coordinates
Week 7 ---Three-dimensional coordinate system, Vectors
Week 8 ---Lines and planes in space, Cylinders and quadric surfaces
Week 9 ---Midterm exam
Week 10 –Vector functions and their derivatives
Week 11 –Functions of several variables, Limits and continuity,
          Partial derivatives
Week 12 –The chain rule, Directional derivatives and gradient
Week 13 –Tangent planes, Extreme values, Lagrange multipliers
Week 14 –Double integrals, Applications of double integrals
          (Second Test)
Week 15 –Triple integrals, Change of variables in multiple integrals
Week 16 –Triple integrals in cylindrical and spherical coordinates
Week 17 –Infinite series, Power series, Taylor and Maclaurin series
Week 18 –Final exam
scorePolicy:
GRADE
1. Homeworks 20%
2. Seminar session 10%
3. Tests(2) 30%
4. Midterm exam 15%
5. Final exam 25%
materials:
TEXTBOOK
Hass/Weir/Thomas: University Calculus, Alternate Edition
                  (Publisher: Pearson Addison Wesley 2007)

REFERENCE BOOK
Stewart: Essential Calculus (Early Transcendentals)
         (Publisher: Thomson 2006)
